architectural_notes: Target: replicate key live.com landing/sign-in flow and redirect/entry experience.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Abstract airy background illustration with soft shapes (signin-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Minimal set of 8 monochrome line icons for tiles (tile-icons.dim_512x512.png)
- Simple neutral brand mark (not Microsoft-like), geometric symbol (app-mark.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Create a Live.com-inspired landing page that presents a clean, minimal sign-in entry experience with an input labeled "Email, phone, or Skype" and primary actions "Next" and "Sign-in options". The page must clearly indicate it is a demo app and must not use Microsoft trademarks, logos, or copyrighted brand assets.

Implement authentication using Internet Identity. Clicking "Next" on the landing page must initiate the Internet Identity login flow, and on success the UI must show a signed-in state with the user principal and a "Sign out" action.

Add a post-sign-in "app launcher" page modeled after the Live.com entry hub: show a grid of product tiles (e.g., Mail, Calendar, People, Files) and a top bar with a search input. Tiles can navigate to simple placeholder pages within the app (no external redirects required).
Wire the frontend to the backend using React Query for: (1) fetching the signed-in user record, and (2) refreshing user state after sign-in/sign-out.

Apply a coherent visual theme for the entire app that evokes a modern, airy sign-in portal (light background, crisp typography, subtle depth), without using Microsoftâ€™s signature branding. Use a consistent color palette, spacing system, and component styles across all pages.
Add generated static image assets required for the landing/launcher UI to frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI (do not serve images via the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a website/app modeled after live.com (Microsoft account sign-in / Outlook entry experience).

Persist a minimal user record in the Motoko canister keyed by principal, including createdAt and lastLogin timestamps, and expose query/call methods to fetch the current user record and update lastLogin on sign-in.
